content.rendered:
Failure To Diagnose Gynecological Cancer

As with any serious illness or life-threatening medical condition, the key to a successful course of treatment lies in early detection.

A timely, accurate diagnosis of any medical condition can determine the correct course of medical treatment and mitigate future injury or even death.

Unfortunately, it is not uncommon for medical providers to miss a diagnosis, particularly for gynecological cancer. A delayed diagnosis can result from numerous factors, including:

  • Not ordering the correct tests
  • Not properly interpreting the test results
  • Not communicating with other departments in the medical facility
  • Not collecting a thorough patient history
  • Not communicating with the patient
  • Not recommending proper follow up
  • Not consulting with appropriate specialists

Over 100 Years Of Combined Experience To Help You Get The Compensation You Deserve

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our lawyers have extensive experience helping individuals in Columbus and throughout Ohio with medical malpractice claims involving failure to diagnose gynecological cancer as well as:

  • Breast cancer
  • Uterine cancer
  • Ovarian cancer
  • Cervical cancer

With over 100 years of combined legal experience, our attorneys are adept at handling your case. We will investigate your situation and determine if any mistakes were made in your care and treatment. We often utilize a team of highly qualified, trusted experts from all over the country to help.

We are committed to fighting for monetary recovery for lost wages, medical treatment, and the pain and suffering of facing a worsening condition due to the doctor’s negligence.

Contact Our Office Today To Learn More

If you have further questions about medical malpractice or pursuing a delayed diagnosis case, contact our firm.

Call 614-360-2706 or fill out our online contact form.

Free consultations. Contingency fee arrangements. We collect attorneys’ fees only if we recover compensation for you.
